mdRecord.dcterms:title: James River, Virginia (in five sheets), Sheet No. 2, Point of Shoals to Sandy Point / issued January 1882 ; J. E. Hilgard Superintendent. Verfied R. D. Cutts Assistant in Charge of Office
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 1 map ; 60 x 90 cm. on sheet 76 x 98 cm..
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Corrections from surveys by Corps of Engineers U.S.A., to June 1896. [original]
Relief shown by hachures. Depths shown by contours and soundings. [original]
Inset: James River, diagram of charts. [original]
In upper margin, left to right: No. 401b Price 40 cents. Plate No. 1693. Electrotype Copy No. 1, U.S.C. & G.S. [original]
In bottom right margin: (James R. Sheet 2) U.S.C. & G.S. 401b. [original]
List of authorities for triangulation, topograpy, hydrograpy, magnetic observations. [original]

"Office work: The reduced drawing of topography and hydrography was made by A. Lindenkohl. The engraving was executed as follows: Outlines and topography by J. Enthoffer; Hydrography by F. Courtenay; Lettering by E.A. Maedel, and Sand by H.M. Knight." [original]
Includes notes on tides, soundings, and buoys. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Nautical charts--Virginia--James River
James River (Va.)--Maps
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
